Detailed Description

template<class CFG>
struct Pika::OOScript< CFG >

OOScript inherits from Pika::Script and adds some classes and functions that help you interfacing PikaScript with your C++ objects.

Definition at line 28 of file PikaObjects.h.

Member Function Documentation

template<class CFG >
static std::pair<Value, String> Pika::OOScript< CFG >::getThisAndMethod ( Frame &  frame  )  [inline, static]

getThisAndMethod splits the $callee variable of frame into object ("this") and method.

The returned value is a pair, where the first value ("this") is a reference to the object and the second value is the method name as a string.

Notice that if the $callee variable does not begin with a "frame specifier", it is assumed that the object belongs to the previous frame (e.g. the caller of the method). This holds true even if the method is actually defined in the root frame. For example 

 function { obj.meth() }
would trigger an error even if obj is defined since obj isn't defined in our function. While 
 function { ::obj.meth() }
works.

One typical use for this function is in a PikaScript object constructor for extracting the "this" reference that should be constructed. Another situation where this routine is useful is if you use the "elevate" function to aggregate various methods into a single C++ function. You may then use this function to extract the method name.
